Name: Einer für Alle!
Description:
Each player gets one or more cards and rollt three dice. The result counts for every player (one for all). The goal of the game is to cover all spaces on ones card with colored tiles. The letter die determines the card (A-F), the color die the row (red heart, blue fish, violet grapes, green frog, yellow butterfly, black raven) and the number die (1-6) the number of tiles card owner may use to cover up the symbols.

The first player to cover up all his cards wins the game.

—user summary

Name: The Coaching Game
Description:
The Coaching Game is Board Game for studied about ICF Coaching Process.
There is 7 Steps of ICF Coaching into The Coaching Game with semi-cooperative easy rule for play
by Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement by Move Token for pick card up for finished eash Board,
when finished 7 Main Board, player went through 7 Steps of ICF Coaching already.

—description from the designer

Name: Scotland Yard: Venice
Description:
Scotland Yard: Venice is a limited edition version of the classic game, only it is set in Venice, Italy. Chase Mr. X through the canals of the lagoon city, using gondolas and speedboats instead of taxis and subways.

The rules of the base game are unchanged.

Name: Cabaret 4 Card
Description:
Each player draws 4 cards that they place face up in front of them. Cards are either "Win", "Lose" or "Last cards. Then, each player takes turns playing a card onto either the left or right side of the playmat.

When you play a card that matches the top card on the left pile, you will either win or lose -- depending on which card is at the top of the right pile!

Last cards can only be played on the left pile. When they are at the top, the condition becomes playing the last of all 8 cards for the round.

An analog version of the video game by ã‚„ã‚Œã‚„ã‚Œ.

Name: The Atlanta Campaign: Peachtree Creek & Jonesboro
Description:
Published in Decision Games's Strategy & Tactics issue #169 The Atlanta Campaign: Peachtree Creek & Jonesboro presents two additional American Civil War wargames for their venerable "Blue & Gray" system. These games are based around the fighting for Atlanta, Georgia during the American Civil War and each wargame, named for the individual battles they portray, is directly continued and combines with Strategy & Tactics Issue 170, Atlanta Campaign: Bald Hill and Ezra Church, to allow gamers to recreate the entire "Atlanta Campaign".

This set of games are often referred to as "Blue & Gray Second Edition" with the series rules being only slightly updated with the standard rules still fully backward-compatible with previous games already published in the Blue & Gray.

This "Second Edition Blue & Gray" series started with Seven Days Battles Seven Days Battles covering battles from the Peninsula Campaign (a stand alone game never released in magazine form), and Strategy & Tactics issue #166 with the battles of  Savage Station and Olustee then continuing with Strategy & Tactics issue #170 which covered the first half of Atlanta Campaign: Bald Hill and Ezra Church and with which this game can be combined into a single, large campaign game that covers key fighting in four major battles around Atlanta, GA during the American Civil War.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Battles of the American Civil War (Decision Games)

Name: Pays de Brest: Morlaix – Le jeu
Description:
Pays de Brest - Morlaix, Le jeu is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the centers of the region and then go travel the 150 communes, from the Monts d'Arrée to Ouessant, from the Crozon peninsula to the Bay of Morlaix...
with 1000 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities....

Name: Zähnchen
Description:
A 4-player-game for kids and family with some educational emphasis on brushing teeth. Like in pachisi players run around a parcours via dice-rolling but with only 1 pawn. The first to reach the goal wins.

The fields of the parcour feature eating meals, sweets or going to bed, which require to have rolled a toothbrush on a 2nd die. If not, 1 of 6 teeth (white dice in front of each player) get "darker" by rolling the w6 again. (even 2 sections if eating sweets.)

Other fields allow players to "brush" one tooth - get it 1 section "brighter" again -, acquire a physical toothbrush - which can be used instead of rolling a toothbrush on the 2nd die - or go back to the "DOC"-field, which totally "whitens" one of the players "teeth".

Some fields (going to bed and teddy-bear) also require the player to skip her/his next turn.

The final 6 steps in the "house" each require 2 eyes of the die and can only be passed if the corresponding "tooth" of the player is completely white. If not, the player has to roll the 2nd die every turn in order to try to get "whiten" this tooth 1 section again. The last step even requires at least a 2 on the W6 AND a toothbrush on the 2nd die.

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – The Temptation of the Scorpion
Description:
The Temptation of the Scorpion is the fourth Dynasty Pack in the Temptations cycle. It contains cards 67-86.

New crises strain the Emerald Empire to its breaking point, and every Great Clan will be tempted and tested—but perhaps none will be more tested than the Scorpion Clan. The survival of the Emerald Empire hangs in the balance, as does the heart of the Scorpion. Will they, and the rest of Rokugan, succumb to the rising darkness?

The Temptation of the Scorpion follows the pattern of the Temptations cycle, as new dire abilities force every clan to carefully consider how to invest fate in their characters. Will you take advantage of new Shadowlands creatures and MahÅ blood magic to taint your deck, or will you rise above these temptations to pursue a path of righteousness?
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Hangry Blobfish
Description:
A Print and Play card game which also can be played solo or coop. You are a skilled hunter chasing the huge government bounties available for capturing these blobfish through baiting them with their favourite foods.

To capture a blobfish a player must match the center 4 icons in the bait holder with the bait icons underneath the blobfish. The player who has captured the most blobfish wins.

Gameplay: Play a card, use the bait card´s effect according, draw a card

Content: 64 cards of which are 52 Plate Cards, 8 Blobfish Cards and 4 Bait Cards.

Name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Miller's Men
Description:
This linked set of scenarios was originally part of Warlord' 75th Anniversary Campaign, collected in full here, with the complete Firefight! rules for convenience.

Take Captain Miller's rangers from the Beach-head on a daring mission to rescue a US soldier of the 101st from deep behind enemy lines in this series of linked scenarios. 
Along the way, take out a radar station and defend the town of Ramelle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Extreme Shogi
Description:
In Extreme Shogi, although the pieces move the same way as in standard Shogi, which pieces you have, and the layout of the board changes from round to round. A game consists of three rounds.

Players each choose a board card and the two cards together determine the layout of the board. Then each player chooses a pieces card which determines what 5 pieces they will play with. The two players will not necessarily have the same set of pieces. A screen is placed across the center of the board and each player arranges their pieces however they like.

When both players are ready, the screen is removed and play commences. As mentioned above, pieces move as in standard Shogi. Whoever first checkmates the opposing king wins the round. The winner of the game is whoever first wins three rounds.

Name: Collage
Description:
A game of words, bluff and tactical decisions where you stick together letters to create a word, or let other players think you know a word with those letters.

Players hold a hand of cards where each card is a letter, or a special rule of word-making. They take turns adding cards to the board, declaring that they know a word that fulfills all the conditions in play. The game stops when a player doubts that another actually knows a word with that conditions. Winner of the challenge and all other players gain points, loser gains a special power for next round.

—description from publisher

Name: The Great Race: Duel
Description:
Enjoy the adventure in new ways with DUEL, discover the solo game, designed in collaboration with Martin Montreuil of the YouTube channel "the game board society".  And change your pace with the addition of a 5th player, an all female team.

With solo mode, the player driving his half-track will have to face the driver of the famous Renault 10 CV Torpedo with 6 wheels. The goal will be to complete 12 missions across Africa and South America.

Name: Magnytour Profil: De Ronde – Tour des Flandres
Description:
The most important cycling race in Flanders "De Ronde", nicknamed Vlaanderens Mooiste ("Flanders' Finest").

260 km of course strewn with hills and cobblestones. 
Patience is key.

Name: Aquifer
Description:
Aquifer is a Hex variant which attempts to find a consistent  turn protocol to replace the pie rule; the game is balanced despite that each turn consists of the same options. In the spirit of Slither, the designer is proud to present yet another connection game in which movement is utilized to solve a specific design problem while providing unique and puzzling tactics as well. The name Aquifer refers to how each player's initial group is the wellspring from which all their other groups originate. Draws are impossible in Aquifer.

Rules

Materials: Any Hex board size 10x10 or larger and an unlimited supply of stones in two colors.

Objective: Connect your two designated sides, Top and Bottom for Black and Left and Right for White with an unbroken chain of pieces.

Gameplay: Starting with Black, on their turn players alternate either placing a stone of their own color that, if possible, must be adjacent to a like-colored stone already on the board. Or alternatively moving one or more of their stones according to the following conventions:

The player selects a group (connected set of like-colored stones) to move stone/s out of. Other friendly stones within the group are sacrificed, by flipping them to the opponent's color, to give the stone/s sliding movement, each sacrifice adds a particular direction of movement to one of the stones being moved. Any number of stones can be sacrificed from the group (which aren't the moving stones of course) except for 1; the group must still exist at the end of the turn. The stones may move in any combination of their purchased directions. When moving, stones can move over friendly stones but not over enemy stones.

-description from designer

Name: Bloodborne: The Board Game – Hunter's Dream Extras/Enemies
Description:
Enemy Versions of each of the unlocked Hunters - increasing the variety even further! Thought coming across the savage Scourge Beasts or frenzied Hunter Mobs was bad? It'll be even worse when you're suddenly onslaughted by the rapid-attacks of a Hunter utilizing the Blade of Mercy! But watch out as well, you'll need to be quick on your feet should you instead come across a foe looking to pound you into gore with the mighty Kirkhammer!

Includes: Saw Cleaver, Threaded Cane, Hunter Axe, Ludwig's Holy Blade, Spear Rifle, Chikage, and Beast Claw.

Contents: 7 enemy miniatures, 7 enemy cards, 7 mini-boss spawn cards, 1 firearm card, 6 reward cards.

Name: Danza
Description: In Danza, which is subtitled "The Hilarious Game of Dance Expectations vs Dance Reality", challenges you to communicate dance steps to your teammates, with them trying to guess what you're doing.

Name: Tanto Cuore: Astrid Wende
Description:
Promo Card released as part of the Kickstarter for Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest.

This card requires Beer cards to play, so requires the use of the Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest base game.

Name: Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest – Toni Darling
Description:
Released as part of the Kickstarter Promo for Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest

PR22: Toni Darling (Extended Art)

Name: Contraband Insider
Description:
Contraband Insider is a deduction board game for 3 to 5 players.

The police are stepping up enforcement efforts to confiscate illegal contraband goods within the city. Unfortunately, players take on the role of moles infiltrated into the police force. These corrupted cops are also known as “insiders” who manipulate various operations to prevent their partnered contraband goods from being confiscated by police raids.

Each round consists of a game setup and 3 gameplay phases:
1. In the Contraband Goods Phase, players are to hide 3 Contraband Cards faced-down among 8 Public Locations and 1 Home Base.
2. In the Police Raid Phase, players take turns to play 1 out of 3 actions.
3. In the Scoring Phase, all the cards in the unraided Public Location and Home Base will be opened and revealed. Players will earn the number of points for the round.

The game is played over 3 rounds, which each round will determine points that add up to the final score. At the end of the game, the player with the highest score wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeon Storming: Mostri Erranti
Description: The box contains a die, rules, 10 monster sheets and 30 miniatures, to add to every game in the Dungeon Storming series, to add variability and new challenges.

Name: Dungeon Storming: The Cultist
Description: This promo expansion can be used with a game from the Dungeon Storming or Cthulhu Storming lines of games, and consists of a metal miniature and a duble-face character sheet.

Name: Gridball
Description:
Gridball is a 2 player game, based on a futuristic fantasy sport. The game is played on an isometric grid, you control a team of 4 players, positioned on the gridline intersections. During a game turn, your team has an allocation of 3 actions, with these action you can choose to Move a player, Check an opponent player, Load the ball or Fire the ball.

The objective of the game is to Fire the ball into your opponent's goal zone. Points are awarded once this happens. The team with the most points at the end of the 30 minute game period are declared the winners.

-description from publisher

Name: Darwin's Journey: Darwin Worker mini-expansion
Description: This mini-expansion includes Darwin's Crew card and a Special Action that allows you to unlock Darwin's pawn which is used just for a single turn and acts as a worker with 6 purple Wax Seals and the Golden distinction.

Name: Problem Solver
Description: Players roll dice and move their pieces around a monopoly-style board. It is designed to reinforce problem solving skills during adolescence. The activity is based upon five skill steps: 1. identify the problem, 2. assume responsibility for it, 3. identify different solutions, 4. try the best solution, and 5. try other solutions if the solution originally chosen does not work.

Name: Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest – Cosplay Promos
Description:
The cosplay promos were pictures of Japanime Games' friends and coworkers who were featured in Oktoberfest as illustrated general maids as well. One was a group photo which was created into a new private maid card. These cards were used only for the Kickstarter and would not be released again until a Cosplay Promo Pack would be released alongside the Tanto Cuore 10th Anniversary Kickstarter.

PR10P1: Julia Kunster - Requires Oktoberfest/Beer cards
PR12P1: Anna Hartmann
PR14P1: Aileen Hammerschmidt
PR22P2: Toni Darling
PR23P1: Nadja Kersten
PR24P2: Gina Kersten - Requires Oktoberfest/Beer cards
PR26: Party Girls (New - Private Maid)

Name: Tanto Cuore: International Promo Set
Description:
A Kickstarter was opened to help get funding to release Tanto Cuore in other languages. With this Kickstarter there were 10 promos released featuring private maids from different countries around the world. Each card was in the maid's native language. English translated cards of each of the promos were released as well.

PR28: Aino Svensen (Norway)
PR29: Celia Forestwood (Canada)
PR30: Olivia Wallace (Australia)
PR31: Consuela de la Fuente (Spain)
PR32: Denise Brondiel (France)
PR33: Pierra Allegrini (Italy)
PR34: Ursula Fassbender (Germany) - Requires Oktoberfest/Beer cards
PR35: Sadie (United States of America)
PR36: Minamo Kaibara (Japan)
PR37: Tamara Orlova (Russia)

Name: Tanto Cuore: Winter Romance – Promo Card Set #5
Description:
With the release of Winter Romance, Arclight released five promo cards which included three extended art cards, a new private maid, and a new concept: an alternate text card.

PR39: Leopold Niebling (Extended Art)
PR40: Beverly Snowfeldt (Extended Art)
PR41: Monica Lindolph (New - Private Maid)
PR42: Friends (Extended Art)
PR45: Do-Over (Alternate Text - Drama)

Name: Tanto Cuore: Winter Romance – Kickstarter Promos
Description:
The Kickstarter for Winter Romance also introduced new promos in the form of alternate text cards and a new private butler. The private butler is, as of this writing, the only private butler currently released.

PR43: Chapel (Alternate Text - Building) - Requires Tanto Cuore or Expanding the House or Winter Romance
PR44: After the Banquet (Alternate Text - Building) - Requires Winter Romance
PR46: Compromise (Alternate Text - Drama) - Requires Winter Romance
PR47: Hated (Alternate Text - Drama) - Requires Winter Romance
PR48: Loneliness (Alternate Text - Drama) - Requires Winter Romance
PR49: Growing Closer (Alternate Text - Drama) - Requires Winter Romance
PR50: Chance Meeting (Alternate Text - Drama) - Requires Winter Romance
PR51: Ross Allison (New - Private Butler) - Any Tanto Cuore Base game

Name: Tanto Cuore: 10th Anniversary Kickstarter Promos
Description:
The Tanto Cuore 10th Anniversary Kickstarter promos. Currently there are seven private maid promos and three new general maid promos.

PR52: Annet Thane (New - Private Maid)
PR53: Ignis Carpenter (New - Private Maid)
PR54: Edith Shirring (New - Private Maid)
PR56: Helene Fontenil (New - Private Maid)
PR57: Catherine Léger (New - Private Maid)
PR58: Chiffon Loudenne (New - Private Maid)
PR59: Cecilia St. Clair (New - Private Maid)
PR60: Frederica Schutz (New - Private Maid)
PR61: Lenor Abreu (New - Private Maid)
PR62: Lynn Ex Compy (New - General Maid)
PR63: Macy Apfel Compy (New - General Maid)
PR64: Wina Does Compy (New - General Maid)

Name: Tanto Cuore: Eris Heartland
Description:
Around the same time as the 10th Year Kickstarter a new private maid was released which you would receive for free with your order when purchasing from Japanime Games' online store.  A foil version of her was available through the Kickstarter as well.

PR55: Eris Heartland (New - Private Maid)

Name: The Game of 49: GameboyGeek Promo Card
Description:
This card has a minimum bid of $2.

"Helping you find the next board game you'll love!"

Name: Grid Wars: Age of Cyberpunk
Description:
The future is built on countless layers of existence. The virtual and physical entwine. The human mind is no longer able to determine which layer is the "original" one. The concept of "real" is way in the past.

The Grid is a dark-web of layers. Filled with millions of ongoing cyber deals and bloody confrontations. The Grid's unique encryption makes it a free-for-all for both the biggest corporations and exclusive cliques of criminals.

In no-mans-land you can be the man. One big score can change your fate forever. But it can get real messy, real fast. So carefully pick your squad, recon the objective, and shift the paradigm in your favor today!

And remember, once you get on the grid you also get on the radar...

GRIDWARS offers a new take on the hex-based skirmish game. Except for a smooth and satisfying combat system, you get a lot of possibilities to interact with the environment, hack your way through the battle, throw enemy and allied units, and even engineer and deploy powerful combat mechs to aid you!

In a single game, you get the experience of wargaming, RGP, board game, and strategy game. Here are a few aspects that contribute to GRIDWARS unique gameplay:


     RPG Scenarios. The game is scenario-based. Every time you will face a different challenge that will allow different characters to excel.
     Squad Building. Before the game, you will pick your squad. Every unit has a cost and each scenario a limit of how many you can use per player. It is up to you to decide if you want to focus on brute force, hacking, or engineering!
     Quick-Paced Skirmish. Players activate one of their units alternately. Each time a unit can execute actions. Move, Charge, Attack, Shoot, Use Abilities, Hack, Build, or even Throw a smaller enemy across the battlefield! Order in which you activate your units and execute actions will be the key to the winning strategy.
     Custom Dice. There are custom attack and defense dice. After the roll, you will be able to improve your results depending on your unit's statistics. The combat mechanics are very intuitive. No math, just choices. You will see everything there is to know on your rolled dice!
     Strategy-Affecting Terrain. The terrain creates a unique setting for each encounter on the grid. You can hide inside the buildings, lock the door, or shoot through the windows, all of which will affect the mechanics.
     Powerful Hacking. The semi-virtual nature of the grid makes hacking a reality-bending feat. By using the terminals located on the battlefield, the hackers can activate the sentry guns, detonate mines, and manipulate electronic objects. By directly hacking the enemy operating systems, they can instantly inflict damage and status effects. 
     Versatile Engineering. Combat engineers can repair or deactivate obstacles. But what's more important, they can learn blueprints and collect materials to deploy just the right combat mechs to change the tide of the battle! 
     Energy System. It's up to you to decide which of your units will be reinforced each turn. At the beginning of a round, you will distribute the Energy. You can spend it to make your attacks and defense more effective or to activate powerful abilities in critical situations. Make sure to impact the battle in places where it is needed the most!
     High Replayability. In every game, you will face different enemies, choose different squads and compete in different scenarios. You can find new synergies between characters in every game!

Name: Bottom of the 9th: Rob Daviau
Description:
Promo card for Bottom of the 9th.

Featuring Rob Daviau as a Starting Pitcher
Playing for the Unpub Prototypes

Name: World Geo Cards
Description:
Five card games in one that make geography fun! 50 Jumbo-sized (4" x 6") cards represent the world's largest countries and include capitals, population, and land area. In addition, game instructions are included for five different easy-to-learn games for 1-4 players.

—user summary

Name: Rikiki et le trésor de Barbe-Noire
Description:
Rikiki et le trésor de Barbe-Noire is a cooperative course game. It is inspired from a children book character created by Marianne Barcilon. The players must collect all the treasures before the Pirate Blackbeard rebuilds his ship and catches them.

In his turn, the player rolls the dice and applies the result among:

     arrows: the front player has as many squares as there are arrows.
     the compass rose: the player draws an action card and applies its effect
     Pirate Flag: The player draws a piece from Blackbeard's ship and begins to assemble it.


When a player stops on a treasure map, he collects one of the tokens there. If the token is the seagull that lays the golden eggs, it collects all the tokens present there.
The action cards allow you to replay, go back, move forward several spaces or even remove a piece from Blackbeard's boat.
The game ends when Blackbeard's boat is completed, the players have lost OR when all the treasure tokens have been collected, the players have won.

Name: Bounce
Description:
Bounce is played on two identical 6x6 grids. The rows and columns are labeled with letters and numbers, and each space contains a letter or number.

Each player uses one of the grids. On a turn a player marks an empty space in their grid, and the letter or number in that space determines the row or column where their opponent must play. That play will determine where the first player must play, and so on.

The winner is the first player to mark four adjacent spaces in a line.

Name: The Last Forest
Description:
After the final world war, we find ourselves in the last living forest on the planet.

A group of animals, blessed by the spirit of nature, will cooperate to face what remains of the devastated, mutant and depraved human race to maintain hope in the last vestige of life.

The Last Forest is a cooperative board game, in which the players are wild animals, who face the dangers that lurk in the last forest.

By combining the forces of their decks, they will solve different exploration challenges together and improve their abilities. In the final phase of the game, they must be ready to defeat one of the different bosses and save the last forest.

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Industrialisation of Sweden
Description:
During the industrial revolution Sweden went from being one of the poor countries of Europe to become one of the wealthiest. Sweden started this era with providing Europe with raw materials like wood and iron and ended it with providing mobile phones, cars and furniture. Surely there must be a way to make your pile of money larger during this expansive era.

In Industrialisation of Sweden players try to make the most money by acquiring and operating historical and present day Swedish companies.

In a series of rounds players acquire companies in auctions that they then operate. Operation of a company consists of purchasing resources from a market and then selling other (hopefully more valuable) resources to the same market. In the end the player with the most money wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Vampyre Hearts: A Trick-Taking Game
Description: Raise the stakes on the classic game of Hearts in a bone-chilling twist to the trick-taking card game! With the Queen of Vampyres hiding amongst your number, her thirst for Hearts may send everyone to an early grave. Can you strike her down before time runs out? Housed in a gorgeous coffin-shaped box, this set includes a deck of unique illustrated playing cards and rules for standard Hearts play as well as expanded rules and a token for a vampyric variation that adds hidden roles and ulterior motives to the fast-paced classic. Prepare for a thrilling and bloodthirsty game night for new players and experts alike!

Name: Ready or Not: The board game that could save your life.
Description:
What if the Red Cross joined with the creators of Trivial Pursuit and Dungeons & Dragons to make a family board game?

This game lets a family have fun while learning how to be safer.  What would you do if you found ET or Casper the ghost in your home?  Does everyone know how to turn the gas or power off to the home or what to do in case of an earthquake or tornado.

The game combines trivia questions with what if questions to see if the family knows what to do.  Is the family Ready or Not in the Real World.

—description from the designer

Name: Rise of the Round Table
Description:
King Arthur has taken the throne of England.  As the Ladies and Lords of the Kingdom, you will need to help the kingdom prosper.  The king gives you quests to build castles, raise forces to defend the kingdom, and expand the Economic base for your lands.
Can you rise to the challenge to bring greatness to Avalon, and by happenstance, your own lands?
A euro game at heart.  Use the unique Rondel movement system to position pieces on the board, gather resources, and complete tasks given by King Arthur.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Medium: a Marshall McLuhan Board Game
Description:
Inspired by legendary Canadian philosopher and innovative media thinker Marshall McLuhan (1911-1980), this board game gamifies Laws of Media. The New Science (1988), developed by Marshall McLuhan and his son Eric McLuhan (1942-2018). Also known as “McLuhans’ Tetrad”, the Laws of Media reveal the four constant rules that govern all human innovations, four questions that can be asked in order to understand the implications that will inevitably result from any medium.

An entertaining and educational board game that stimulates players’ cooperative, innovative, and creative thinking skills.

Educational and hilarious for the novice and expert alike, The Medium is fast-paced, engaging and brainy fun that will have young and old laughing... as they learn out loud.

This game is played in teams of two or more players. Each round, one team member tries to get their team to guess the medium on the card. Clues take the form of answers to the four questions of The Laws of Media. Teams move along the board when a medium is guessed correctly, pulling themselves out of the Maelstrom.

Use The Medium to analyze an artifact or human innovation from the past or present, and enjoy being the first team to escape the media maelstrom!

—description from the designer

Name: Cold War Combat: ACM
Description:
Cold War Combat is a miniature wargame based around the Cold War. 
The initial entry in the series, Cold War Combat: ACM focuses on fighter jet combat.
The game features a streamlined ruleset that makes it easy for beginners to pick up and play, with additional advanced rules that can be applied to add layers of depth to the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Stronghold: Undead (Second Edition) – Council's Deliberations Expansion
Description:
The Council cards expand the gameplay of Stronghold: Undead (Second Edition) by allowing the defender to use the powers of the Pearl Keep's High Council.

In this expansion, the Council deliberates each round and makes decisions to bolster the Defender's power against the onslaught of the undead hordes.

Name: Terraforming Mars: Bio Printing Facility Promo Card
Description:
Promo card for Terraforming Mars, available at the Fryxgames webshop.

Bio Printing Facility

Introducing new species on demand.

Action: Spend 2 energy to gain 2 plants OR to add 1 animal to ANOTHER card.

Promo card X36

Name: Zombie World Order
Description:
ZWO is a two-player competitive TCG. Players take on the role as one of the few survivors in a zombie-infested world. Use magic to summon zombies! The game system revolves around revival and toughness! With the toughness to survive whatever is dished out, and revival to bring cards back from the dead, the fun never dies! Battle it out with zombie minions: it’s a fight to the undeath!

—description from the publisher

Name: BatKrun: Alons bat'karé La Réunion
Description:
BatKrun is the contraction of the Creole word “Bat’Karé” (to walk) and Run (short for Réunion) and can be translated as “Alons bat’karé La Réunion”. 
This game, which received the Innovation Award from the Technopole de La Réunion in 2015, offers its players a real immersion in the daily life of Reunion Island, with its traditions, its living together, its magnificent landscapes and is intended for all lovers of Reunion.

The goal of the game is to obtain the famous title of Ambassador of Reunion by gathering the 5 Ambassador cards of the 5 zones of the game: North, East, South, West and Les Hauts.

Gameplay: the player, called BatKareur, must travel through all the municipalities of the island, answer questions about Reunion, live endemic adventures, attack his opponents and protect himself from their attacks in order to become Ambassador of Reunion.

Name: Arcane Bakery Clash: Boss Bake-Off 2
Description:
A 3-Card Solo Expansion for Arcane Bakery Clash.

SETUP
Select one of the Rayn cards and place it face up. Place the other two cards face-down on either side, these are Rayn's mitts. Place a coin at the top of Rayn's energy track and do the same for both mitts.

Remove the Cheesequake and Omen Biscotti cards. Shuffle the remaining recipe cards.

HOW TO PLAY
Play using the standard game rules, adding the rules listed below:

When you deal damage, target either of Rayn's mitts. If you reduce one of them to 0 energy, deal 1 damage to Rayn, and tilt the mitt to show that it is broken. You may only deal damage to Rayn directly if both mitts are broken.

On Rayn's turn, roll a die. If the result matches a number on one of her mitts, activate it. If the mitt is broken, fix it: untilt it and set the coin to 3 energy. If not broken, take the action shown on the mitt.

(One roll of the dice counts as a boss' "action". If they get an extra action, they roll an extra die. If they lose an action, they roll 1 less.)

VICTORY
If Rayn has 0 energy and you still have any, you win. If you are ever reduced to 0 energy, you lose.

Name: Barbarossa Brief, 1941
Description:
Brief as in both speed of play and File or Case or ... Dossier. :)

VERY small footprint Barbarossa game.  Like Philip Sabin's classic Eastern Front, only **3** hexes from Warsaw to Moscow, although a different configuration of those.

4 2-month turns, basic hex and counter dice-resolved combat odds system.  But lots of combat options including Pressed Attack, No Retreat! - isn't there a game by that name? :) - Siberian Reserve Gamble, etc.  NO Zones of Control.

Playing time:  est. 40 minutes.

Germans:  3 army groups, 1+1 infantry armies, 4 panzer groups, 2+1 panzerkorps.  Romanian army group.  Russians:  10 infantry fronts, 4 operational tank groups, the Siberians.  +3 Russian tank factories (in Leningrad, Kharkov, and Stalingrad).  So 31 pieces total.

Unlike in Phil Sabin's Eastern Front, rivers and hills/mountains *are* specified.  At such a small scale, the Sea of Azov had to be tortured to fit, but all the surrounding areas/hexes relate properly, so ....  (It *could* be done ... sort of ... Phil!  :) )

Very adaptable to fast, easy solitaire play, as obviously as problems arise for both sides.

—description from designer

Name: Munchkin Apocalypse: Kaiju
Description:
Enjoy nuclear-powered battles, city-stomping showdowns, and off-planet altercations with Munchkin Apocalypse: Kaiju. Get barbecued by Hamera, take a sledgehammer to Rocky Road Dan, and win the day with the help of a Rousing Theme Song and a Small Child in Shorts.

—description from the publisher

Name: Martian Merchants
Description:
A Looney Pyramids pickup-and-deliver puzzle game

As interplanetary merchants, shipping and trading goods throughout the galaxy, you race to be the first to bring desired goods back to the inhabitants of your home planets.

Large pyramids represent planets, which form the planetary navigational grid on the playing area. Ships travel between adjacent planets on the grid, which expands as more planets are discovered. The planets of your color are your home planets.
Medium pyramids are ships, which you use to travel from planet to planet making deliveries and establishing stations. You control three ships of your own color.
Small pyramids are goods, which are the commodities being picked up and delivered by your ships. The inhabitants of each planet desire goods of their planet’s own color. When you deliver a good to each of your home planets, you establish stations there.
The object of the game is to be the first player to establish 3 stations, one at each of your home planets.

—description from the designer

Name: Dragonscales: Scroll Of The Tower Promo Card
Description:
Originally available at GenCon 2019 from Arcane Wonders.

Discard this card at any time to take 5 Dragonscales from the Hoard and then distribute them as you wish amongst any number of players.

Name: Drop Racer Battles
Description:
In the future, the most coveted sports prize is the Golden Drop Trophy. To win it, drop racers from around the world gear up their cars with deadly weapons and enter the Drop Arena. If a Racer can get the most drops in the Arena, they win. They have to watch out though, because cannons, lasers, and more will be aimed at them to try to take away their chance for victory. Do you have what it takes to be the next Drop Racer champion? Welcome to Drop Racer Battles!

Drop Racer Battles is a quick-playing dexterity game about flicking race cars on the table, collecting drops, and using weapons on your car to snatch victory from your opponents. The player with the most drops at the end wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Horror Trivia
Description:
150 game cards, each featuring two horror film trivia questions (with answers on the back) and one of five weapon icons in the corner.

A trivia question is read from the card and the currently active team attempts to answer.  If successful, the next question is read and they attempt to answer it also. If both answers were correct, they collect the card.  Play passes to the next team.
The first team that collects 3 different weapons wins the game!

Name: 4 Squared Card Game
Description:
4 Squared is a simple game with mechanics akin to the classic Connect Four while pulling from the popular neon color palettes of the 80's!

The goal of 4 Squared is to be the first player to create a square of the color you have drawn before any of the other players; be it by brute-force, with cunning, deception, luck, or logic! You do this by out-playing your opponents and placing your 4 Squared cards with a matching color and position on top of other cards within the 4 x 4 square play area.

A typical round of 4 Squared is about 10 minutes long and can be played with anywhere between 2-4 players, each with their own hand of three cards!

4 Squared also has variations in it's base rule set that allows other ways to play!

—description from the designer

Name: Chute: La Parrilla F.C.
Description:
Welcome to the hot city of “Las Brasas” where there is nothing better than the smell of a large grill full of the best cuts of meat to feed a group of friends addicted to playing football. This is well known to Barry Mac, the coach of “La Parrilla F.C” who takes care to keep the barbecue at full fire during the 90 minutes of the game, filling his squad with football spirit.

In your deck of La Parrilla F.C you will find everything you need to feed your team with good cuts and soccer skills. Strategically, use coal and meat cards to improve your players. Knowing when to keep an active meat menu is essential, it is all in the handling of coal.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Bienvenidos a la caliente ciudad de “Las Brasas” donde no hay nada mejor que el olor de una gran parrilla llena de los mejores cortes de carne para alimentar a un grupo de amigos adictos a jugar al balonpié. Esto lo sabe muy bien Barry Mac, el DT de La Parrilla F.C que se preocupa de mantener el asado a todo fuego durante los 90 minutos de partido, llenando de espíritu futbolero a su plantel.

En tu mazo de La Parrilla F.C encontrarás todo lo necesario para alimentar a tu plantel de buenos cortes y habilidades futboleras. Utiliza estratégicamente el carbón y las cartas de carne para mejorar a tus jugadores. Saber cuando mantener una carta de carne activa es fundamental, está todo en el manejo del carbón.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chute: Sportivo La Polpetta
Description:
Directly from the province of Bigoli, the “Chutemundo” welcomes the darkest and most rude characters seen so far in the league. From practices that border on the illegal, they bring with them a defensive, treacherous and threatening strategy. While their link to the mob is unconfirmed, they don't go out of their way to prove their innocence.

Sportivo La Polpetta presents you with a series of new special actions and items that you can use to gain advantages over the rival team. With an emphasis on defense, you can tailor your strategy to contain your opponent's attack and score at the right time.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Directamente desde la provincia de Bigoli, se unen al Chutemundo los personajes mas sombríos y rudos vistos hasta el momento en la liga. De prácticas que bordean lo ilegal traen consigo una estrategia defensiva, traicionera y amenazante. Si bien su vínculo a la mafia no está confirmado, no se esfuerzan por demostrar su inocencia.

Sportivo La Polpetta te presenta una seria de nuevas acciones especiales y objetos que puedes utilizar para ganar ventajas sobre el equipo rival. Con un énfasis en el aspecto defensivo, puedes adaptar tu estrategia para contener el ataque del adversario y atacar en el momento preciso. A continuación te damos a conocer el funcionamiento dealgunas de las nuevas cartas.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chute: Atlético Pantera
Description:
Agile, fast and fearless. From Narang, the first women's team comes to the League. It is Atlético Pantera, that with a wild and daring approach proposes to revolutionize the “Chutemundo”. Meet these warriors trained by nature itself, ready to demonstrate their skills on the field of play.

With this expansion you will be able to modify the court with the new "Jungle" cards that will help your players to move and improve their skills. Use them in the correct spaces to weaken your opponent and boost your squad.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Ágiles, veloces e intrépidas. Desde Narang, llega el primer equipo femenino a la Liga. Se trata de Atlético Pantera que con un planteamiento selvático y atrevido propone revolucionar el Chutemundo. Conoce a estas guerreras entrenadas por la naturaleza misma, listas para demostrar sus destrezas en el campo de juego.

Con este mazo podrás modificar la cancha con las novedosas cartas de “Selva” que ayudarán a tus jugadoras a moverse y mejorar sus habilidades. Úsalas en los espacios correctos para debilitar a tu rival y potenciar a tu plantel.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chute: La Perla United
Description:
All hands on deck! is heard at full volume through a large megaphone in “Laguna Carnada” on match days. Accustomed to the harsh life on the high seas, the “La Perla United” squad brings a powerful maritime strategy to the “Chutemundo”. Ready your cannons and ignite the gunpowder of this team full of ruffians and mercenaries ready for battle.

La Perla United is distinguished by its tricks of skilled pirates and wise sailors. Their time at sea has made them rough, and they have discovered how to control the most powerful creature in the depths… the Kraken!!! use it to score and destroy your rivals with his unique skills. It is not an easy task, but the reward of summoning him is gigantic.

—description from the publisher (translated)

¡Todos a sus puestos! se escucha a todo volumen por un gran megáfono en Laguna Carnada los días de partido. Acostumbrados a la dura vida en alta mar, el plantel de La Perla United trae al Chutemundo una estrategia marítima potente, alista tus cañones y enciende la pólvora de este equipo lleno de rufianes y mercenarios listos para la batalla.

La Perla United se distingue por sus trucos de piratas hábiles y sabios navegantes. Su tiempo en el mar los ha convertido en discípulos de éste y han descubierto como controlar a la criatura mas poderosa de las profundidades, descubre al “Kraken” y úsalo para destruir a tu rival. No es tarea fácil, pero la recompensa es gigantezca.

—description from the publisher

Name: Instant Air Hockey
Description: Play Air-powered hockey on nearly any table with this game. The set includes two nets with suction cups to secure the goals, two hand-held paddles for shooting and blocking the puck, and one battery-operated foam puck that floats on a cushion on air. Play on any table or flat surface. The player who scores the most goals within an agreed upon period of time wins!

Name: Warfleets: FTL
Description:
Warfleets: FTL is a miniature wargame set in a distant galaxy at war, designed for spaceships of all scales. The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging spaceship battles for new and experienced players alike.

The game is played with 10-15 models per fleet.
Players put together a fleet and fight to secure and retrieve objective markers, using battlefleet tactics to win. The game features alternating ship phases and brutally quick combat, keeping both players engaged at all times.
Turn Sequence:
1. Squadrons Phase
2. Light Ships Phase
3. Medium Ships Phase
4. Heavy Ships Phase

This rulebook adds lots of extra content to the core rules, providing you with countless hours of epic spaceship battles that you can customize however you like. The rules are written to be concise and to the point, and come with beautiful illustrations as well as helpful example diagrams.

Here's everything that's included in this rulebook:

     Core Rules
     Advanced Rules
         Terrain Placement
         Deployment Styles
         Extra Missions
         Boarding Actions
         Random Events
         Battlefield Conditions
         Terrain & Objective Effects
    
     Total Conversions
         Fog of War
         Catastrophic Damage
         Order Dice
         Ordnance Tokens
         Command Dials
         Shields & Defensive Tokens
         Scanner Ranges
         Planetary Control
         Multiplayer Games
         Kitchen Table Games
    


Note that the factions book is available for free on the publisher website, and is not part of this rulebook. If any updates are made to the rules, then the online version of the rulebook will also be updated.

Name: The Machiavelli
Description:
The king has died and with only the twin princes remaining, both have claim to the crown, which means its time for internal war!

The Machiavelli is an abstract two player board game where you must place and then move your pieces to either form a lign of 5 of your 6 pieces or flank the enemy prince with two of your pieces in order to depose him and become the new king.

This game is one that may be quick and simple to learn however through gameplay you may find it's difficult to master due to the verity of different play styles and combinations you can experience in the quick yet intense matches you play against your friends and foes

Inspired by many ancient games such as nine men's morris among others this game would not be out of place amongst rowdy tavern goers or stern military generals and soldiers.

Name: Antenna TV Opoly
Description:
A monopoly like game with properties that feature TV shows that air on Antenna TV.

Unique tokens include: Clock Tower, Mailman, Ferris Wheel, Jukebox, Cowboy Hat, and Convertible.

Name: Climate Change 2030: The Tile Game
Description:
A safe and just space on Earth is the ring between an environmental ceiling and a social foundation.  The conditions affecting the ceiling and the foundation shift and change during game play.

Mitigate conditions, with hidden objective cards, to make a safe and just space on Earth by making sets and controlling areas to score the most points.

—description from the designer

Name: Climate Change 2030: Running out of Time
Description:
The year is 2021. Climate change is felt by many. The Earth is ravaged, and the people lack basic necessities. Can you create a Safe and Just space on Earth before the point of no return.

During each of ten turns from 2021 to 2030, you'll use a set of 5 mitigation cards to mitigate environmental or social conditions and to expand your research lab.

The cards and the lab allow you to remove 'danger' blocks and install 'protection' blocks from 11 conditions on the Safe and Just Doughnut Board.

At the end of 2030, you need to have removed all of the red blocks and installed all of the green blocks for the best win scenario, but beware, every year catastrophe can add more red blocks.

—description from the designer

Name: Disney Tsum Tsum  Stacking Dice Game
Description:
This is a stacking game with characters from the Disney franchise.

There are two versions of this game. The First version is aimed for kids who are 6+. Place all blue-edged cards face up. To play this version of the game the player rolls 3 dice (up to 3 times) until they get a pair and a star, or if you roll 3 stars; afterwards the player stacks the dice in the form of a triangle. The same player can then take 3 cards from the deck or another player.

The one with the most points wins!

The 8+ version  is kind of similar except you use all the coloured cards.
there is also a card element

Name: Bushido: Hikari
Description:
In life, Hikari was one of four sisters who found their shugenja abilities were amplified when they worked as a coven. The fateful night the sisters were offered a bargain with Yurei, the others readily accepted the power they would gain but Hikari stood firm and refused, knowing the bargain would never be anything but a yolk around their necks and a pathway to evil. The bargain was offered only to the whole coven so her sisters murdered her and accepted the bargain as three Yuta. Hikari is still powerfully linked to them so her sisters raised her as a Kairai and forced her to obey their commands but sometimes she finds the will to fight free.

Hikari’s unique connection to the Yuta means she offers even more flexibility to the Yuta box and, importantly she can use the Chaos Bolt Ki Feat and automatically win the opposed Ki test since she is Soulless. Choosing when to throw off her undead nature and assert control is key to making the best use of her profile.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the designer

Name: Twin Realms
Description:
Twin Realms is a complex dungeon crawler.

Players will be controlling elemental spirits that protect the world from an army of demons. Each quest is unique and many of them have specific objectives. They are not only limited to "kill all that moves".
The combat is played in turns on a board (different for every quest) divided into squares and players will be able to perform actions using a deck of ability cards unique to each elemental spirit.
The distinct feature of the game is hinted in its name. You will be playing in two realms. Physical, and spiritual. The playable characters as well as enemies have 2 forms with different abilities in each realm. The movement will be different in each realm. And some board elements will be different between realms (imagine walls that you can pass through as a spirit but not in physical form). The combat and gameplay will be guided by the fact that you will have to switch between realms to optimize your combat abilities, to avoid enemy attacks etc.

All characters will be developed by levelling up from 1 to 10. Apart from regular upgrades to health and your ability cards you will be able to choose additional perks and choose your path in the game. You can focus on passive abilities, special system of attack modifiers, additional boosts to your cards or special rage cards. You will not be able to maximise all of the perks so every player will be able to build their character in their own way. You can build a character with a very strong set of cards less reliable on attack modifiers. You can build a character that has no upgrades on the cards but most of the attack modifiers are critical hits, burn targets, disarm them or add other status effects. You can build a character that does not focus on any of that but instead generates a ton of rage and exploits various bonuses of the rage deck.

Each character will be able to fulfil a specific role in the company based on its abilities and its build. The roles are the usual set of tanks, assassins, mages and supports. However, that only applies to the physical realm.
While in physical realm each character will try to fulfil their assigned role, in spirit realm all characters are the same, which means that in spirit realm you will share the responsibilities of dealing and taking damage. When you kill enemy spirits, you will be gathering their essence and taking over their actions to create interesting combat situations.

The game takes place in a unique world not long after its creation. There are no humans, dwarves, elves or any other races yet in it. The elementals and the demons are being led by primordial forces of good and evil. As you progress through the game you will learn more about the mythology of this world and what role you play in the history of things.

—description from the designer

Name: Bushido: Miyakomo Korra
Description:
Daughters of the Waves, Sea Witches, Miyakomo sisters… known by many names these shugenja are some of the Jung’s most important allies. The very waves are Korra’s to command and she mercilessly batters her enemies with tide and waves.

Miyakomo's ability to move enemy models like the tides is very useful and combined with Fog of Hesitation, she is a powerful control piece; able to dictate where and when the Jung engage their enemies.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Moyasu
Description:
Moyasu was cursed to burn forever without being consumed. She was offered respite under the ocean by the sea Kami but any part of her that extends above the waves bursts into flames! Like others with the blessing of the sea Kami, she has taken on some aspects of sea creatures.

On the table Moyasu requires a delicate balance as she can be as dangerous to your own models as the enemy, much like fire used as a weapon at sea. Her ability to hold a model in place while giving out many fire markers makes for a very powerful effect, if you can position her well.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Ryujin – Spirit of the Deep
Description:
Ryujin is the Spirit of the Deep Ocean, one of the most powerful Kami in the Jwar Isles. It is rumoured that the very act of calling him forth caused the tsunami that devastated the region. All lesser water Kami are his to command and in some ways are part of him. The Sea Witches of the Jung have bound him to a form of a great water serpent and he has blessed them with his aid. Bushido’s biggest model does not disappoint on the table! With his Tsunami and Incoming Tide abilities, Ryujin affects the game without making an attack but he also has powerful melee and ranged abilities. Finally, he has the Believer ability for Miyakomo models making their Ki Feats considerably more efficient.

Box contains one 98mm tall miniature supplied with integrated base and one full colour card. Product is multi part and assembly is required.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Axiam
Description:
Axiam is a Jonin or “High Man” in the Shadow Wind Clan. He has proven greater than the Shadow Crows and now teaches those who would be North Star Ninja. Still some missions must be overseen by more experienced hands and Axiam shows why he is fit to teach the next generation with his prodigious skill. In the game Axiam has high melee skill, rare among ninjas and the only North Star model to have such high base statistic. His range of abilities is unparalleled as he can use any Feat of any North Star Ninja. He adds to this unpredictability with his Equipment rule allowing you to choose an Equipment Card mid game to suit the exact
circumstances you are in.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shadow Tactics: Ronin expansion
Description:
Ronin is a Kickstarter exclusive expansion to Shadow Tactics - The Board Game that gives solo and cooperative modes to the game.
In this mode the Daimyo player is replaced by an automated rules system, relying on different types of actions with specific dice to roll.

There are several Daimyo actions like moving or defending a target, deployment, or roll call, that could be some potential tactics of a human Daimyo player. There are certain actions when the guards' movement very directly depends on what actions the ninjas actually programmed during that turn, so you have to make your plans very carefully and in close cooperation.

Name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Moloch the Beginning
Description:
Moloch the Beginning Campaign is a two-player expansion for Neuroshima Hex! 3.0. It depicts the beginning of humanity’s fight with the rebellious artificial intelligence, Moloch. The first months on the battlefield are pure madness, which means that even one insignificant soldier or bad day could lead to mission failure!

The campaign is a two-player game consisting of five consecutive missions. At the beginning, players must choose a Faction — Moloch or Outpost — that they will lead through the entire campaign. Each mission consists of special rules that change the gameplay of the Mission.

—description from the publisher

Name: Schism: Immolation of Oethenfur
Description:
Take control of the faction of your choosing and go toe-to-toe against your friends. You’ll have to be cunning and quick to win victory. Build your own unique battle terrain with Tiles for a BRAWL battle, CLASH, or KING OF THE HILL. The game ends when one player claims victory by defeating all enemy Champions, or after 10 rounds.

Schism is easy to learn, has endless strategic possibilities, and has high quality miniatures that are ready to paint if you’re a miniature painting enthusiast!

Schism is the fast-paced table top Skirmisher for 2 to 4 players from Arcanist Entertainment, designed to be quick and easy to learn even for complete beginners to the genre.


     Choose a champion to ACTIVATE
     MOVE a number of Hex equal to their movement stat
     ATTACK
     END TURN


—description from the publisher

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P0kv7wOJvtw

Name: 紅茶ロマン紀行 (Romantic Tea Trip)
Description:
Romantic Tea Trip is set in early modern England. You are a merchant who trades in black tea. Make your business a success by growing black tea around the world, such as Darjeeling and Assam, and promoting new methods of drinking tea, such as Earl Grey and the use of tea bags!

Your goal is to become the King of Tea.

In this game, you move your rabbit piece forward one to three steps and perform the effects of the card you land on to collect Tea Chests or increase the value of the Tea Chests you  already have.

You use Tea Chests you have collected in this way to acquire cards. The victory points awarded are written on the acquired cards; the first player to reach 100 points is the winner.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: ASL Action Pack #16: From the Land Down Under
Description:
Action Pack #16: From The Land Down Under features a new map (15a/b) and 15 new scenarios designed and playtested by the Australian ASL community. Spearheaded by Andrew Rogers (Hatten In Flames), the scenarios of Action Pack #16 feature actions and combatants from all around the globe.

Action Pack #16: From The Land Down Under contains:
one new 11" x 16" double-sided ASL mapboard (15a/b)
15 new ASL scenarios (AP160-AP174):

AP160 Carrier Hill – 6 turns, 22 April 1941, Tobruk, Libya
    AP161 ANZAC Boys – 5 turns, 27 May 1941, Chania, Crete
    AP162 The Governor – 4½ turns, 19 June 1941, Merdjayoun, Syria
    AP163 Dingoes At Damour – 5½ turns, 9 July 1941, Damour, Syria
    AP164 Sparrow Force – 5½ turns, 22 February 1942, Oesau, West Timor
    AP165 The Chocos – 4½ turns, 26 July 1942, Oivi, New Guinea
    AP166 Aussie Alamo – 6½ turns, 28 January 1943, Wandumi, New Guinea
    AP167 All The King’s Enemies – 5½ turns, 30 January 1943, Wau, New Guinea
    AP168 Nameless Hill – 5 turns, 30 December 1943, Razorback Ridge, New Britain
    AP169 The Beasts Have Arrived – 5½ turns, 16 April 1944, Seredynki, Ukraine
    AP170 Never On Time – 6 turns, 28 June 1944, Mouen, France
    AP171 Pössl’s Posse – 5½ turns, 12 July 1944, Kaunas, Lithuania
    AP172 Hickory Lickin’ – 5½ turns, 16 October 1944, Würselen, Germany
    AP173 The Bend – 4½ turns, 16 January 1945, Hatten, France
    AP174 Forest Gumm – 5½ turns, 19 January 1945, Weyersheim, France

Designed for the aficionado, Action Pack #16: From The Land Down Under is not a complete product and assumes the buyer owns the core Advanced Squad Leader game system.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #12: ASL Scenario Bonus Pack for Winter Offensive 2021
Description:
ASL Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #12 (2021) features three new scenarios and one new map (14a/b) for the Advanced Squad Leader system.

MMP has an ulterior motive, however, for the manufacture and sale of this particular product. Proceeds from the sales of each WO Bonus Pack #12 are donated to the WWII Foundation. You get a new map, three more ASL scenarios, and help a great project dedicated to memorializing the efforts of the men who fought in WWII get a very nice donation. This really seems like a win/win in our opinion.

ASL Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #12 (2021) contains:
one new 11" x 16" double-sided ASL mapboard (14a/b)
three new ASL scenarios (WO36-WO38):

WO36 Dompaire Destruction – 4½ turns, boards 11b & 14a, 13 September 1944, Dompaire, France
    WO37 The Vital Hours – 5½ turns, board 14a, 17 September 1944, Wolfheze, The Netherlands
    WO38 Three Bars of Chocolate – 7½ turns, board 14a, 29 November 1944, Lindern, Germany

Designed for the aficionado, Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #12 is not a complete product and assumes the buyer owns the core Advanced Squad Leader game system.

-description from publisher

Name: ViceVersi
Description:
ViceVersi is an abstract strategy game for 2 players. You can play it immediately if you have Othello/Reversi.

As setup, arrange 64 double faced disks as the checkers pattern (as the diagram above). The object is to connect all your color orthogonally on the board.

GAMEPLAY
At first, white choose a disk facing black color up and flip it over.
Then black takes turn and from then on, players alternate turns taking one of two action below.

(1. Choose a pair of disks with opponent’s color facing up that are orthogonally sandwiching one of your color disk or an unbroken line of your color disks, flip them over to friendly color. You may not divide an opponent’s group to two or more groups by this action, unless it makes your winning condition.

(2. Choose a disk with your color facing up, flip it over to opponent’s color. It is required the target disk is not a part of your largest group, and adjacent the largest group of opponent’s color.

If both players achieve the winning condition simultaneously, the turn player wins.

-description from designer

Name: Myraclia: LUNA
Description:
Harvest the energy only the universe can provide.
But everything precious comes with a price...

- - -

Consisting only of a drafting board extension and shiny cube, Luna may appear gimmicky at the first glance. But this single chunk of metal holds divine powers never seen before. It adds to an already tense drafting mechanism precious Element everybody craves for that tests the will and self-restraint to their limits.

Compatible with Eternity and Darkness expansions.

—description from the designer

Name: TV Canal 1
Description:
From the box:
Have you ever thought how fantastic the life of a television executive is?
Taking care of programs, messing with schedules, finding creative solutions is undoubtedly a fascinating activity!
That's why you'll like TV CHANNEL 1! In this game you will experience all the emotions that govern the life of a TV channel! Play a game! And have real fun!

The players are in charge of one of the TB stations that competed in São Paulo, in 1975 (Cultura, Tupi, Globo, Record, Gazeta and Bandeirantes). Each turn, players buy TV shows and decide if they want to produce and fit them in their grid or keep in their archive. The audience rating of a particular TV show will determine the amount of cash each player will receive. After that, the players will change their grid, archiving some shows or selling them.

The player with more money at the end of the game wins.

Name: Fashion 101
Description:
Fashion 101 is a lightweight mix-and-match game for ages 8+ that challenges players to create outfits that match fashion themes revealed during each round of the game. You can be literal, creative, or quirky in your interpretation of any given theme—as long as you delight the "Fashion Judge," who awards style points to each winning outfit. Think of it as “Apples to Apples” with a fashion twist!

What if you don’t have the pieces in your wardrobe needed to pull off a great outfit? Play one of your “Fashion Emergency” cards to improve your collection or bamboozle other players. But be careful—timing is everything!

Fashion 101 was invented in 2017 by 10-year-old Elsa Brandt. In 2020, her mom began working with her to bring the game to fruition as a way to combat boredom and create a fun learning experience during the Covid lockdown in Seattle.

—description from the designer

Name: Robocity
Description:
Program your robots and be the first to get your robots to the finish!

Each player controls four robots which are programmed each round by playing cards face-down on your board. Use energy to buy new cards, upgrade your handsize or remove cards from your deck.

Robocity adds some new twists to the deckbuilding genre: cards you buy are added to your hand and can be used immediately, a dynamic handsize, the use of powerfull - one time used - special cards and the use of resource management outside your deck in the form of energy.

—description from the designer

Name: Snakes Magic & Ladders
Description:
Snakes Magic & Ladders is an easy, fun yet challenging board game played with 2-5 players. If you can throw the dice, you'll start playing in less than 5 minutes! The game is simple, fun and full of cool ways to beat the game! Grab a power-up and enjoy a super boost, keeping you invincible for as long as you can avoid the dangers and traps as you climb to spot 100! The more players, the more fun! You can: - Climb Ladders - Attack Other Players - Get Power-ups - and much more! Think you got what it takes to win the game by reaching spot #100 first?

—description from the designer

Name: Nickelodeon Six Pix
Description: Players move around a square game board a number of spaces equal to the number of differences he/she can spot from a card with two similar images. On some spaces, players may have to turn the card upside down or keep one eye closed while spotting the differences. The player who reaches the finish first wins the game.

Name: Bristol 1350: Bonus Character Cards
Description: Adds 9 bonus character cards to the Bristol 1350 base game. From the back: "Beware of whom you trust, and best of luck!"

Name: Bounce Bunny Bounce
Description:
Bounce Bunny Bounce is a two-player, fast-paced strategy game with an element of memory. The object of the game is to collect the most carrots but in order to win, you'll need to avoid some hazards along the way!

Using this unique deck of cards to form the field of play, your Bunny will Bounce across the field in search of carrots while avoiding traps and dead-ends. There is also a chance for mischief as each player is equipped with Shock cards that can be used to Bounce your Bunny into danger.

This easy-to-learn and fun-to-play game is a great choice for folks who are short on time and looking for a game they can Bounce into quickly.

—description from the designer

Name: Spillin' Beans
Description:
When you think you know your friends, friend's friends or that big mouth that shows up every once in a while, we guarantee you don't...until they spill the beans!

Spillin' Beans is composed of 120 cards that need to be shuffled before starting the game.  Players take turns drawing cards: Action, Wild and Big Bean that keep every player on their toes.

If the player fails to complete the action card, they will place 2 beans in the bean pot. The player to stockpile the most beans wins!

With Spillin' Beans you and your friends will spill stories, place bets, reveal the size of your brain through a dynamic, competitive, and hilarious gameplay.

Name: Kleiner Hut, mach's gut!
Description:
Players each place six cone-shaped playing pieces on the outermost ring and try to reach the center of six concentric circles. Play begins by each player moving a piece to the left or to the right inside the outermost ring, as many spaces as the dice roll. The piece can move over other pieces, but can only cover or stack on another piece that it lands on. When a player covers another player's piece, instead of throwing the next throw, he/she progresses into the second ring.

Another variant exists for 6 players (product code 101/2)

—user summary

Name: 3 x Naturspielspass
Description:
Three nature-themed games in one : 

     Which trees can you name? 
     Where the wild animals live
     What lives in the city



     Match trees, leaves, flowers, and fruits to collect tree tokens. The player with the most trees wins the game.
     The task list determines which African wild animal should be found and photographed. The first to accomplish the task is the safari photo winner and have learnt where his animals live.
     A city provides living space for animals. Discovering them and assigning them to the animals is a playful and interesting task.


—user summary

Name: Professor Sielmanns Naturquiz
Description:
Players answer questions about nature by placing their chips onto a card belonging to one of three categories: air, land, and sea. The questions are about record-breaking and interesting properties of plants and animals.

—user summmary

Name: Jerusalem: '48
Description:
Jerusalem: '48 is a module for the Arab Israeli War of 1948 focusing on the battle of Jerusalem, from December 1947 to 18 July 1948.

GENESIS II is needed to play this module.
It offers larger hexes, lay-flat, hard boards.
4 scenarios are included.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Dominion Faction Pack: The Cardassian Union
Description: The Dominion Faction Pack: The Cardassian Union is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Dominion faction: a Galor class, 2 Keldon class and a Klingon Bird-of-Prey class. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 28 cards. The ships and cards are focused on the Cardassian elements of the Dominion.  Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Vulcan Faction Pack: Live Long and Prosper
Description: The Vulcan Faction Pack: Live Long and Prosper is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Vulcan and Federation factions: 2 D'Kyr class, a Federation Constitution class and a Federation Nebula class. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 27 cards.  Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Klingon Faction Pack: Blood Oath
Description: The Klingon Faction Pack: Blood Oath is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Klingon faction: a Negh'Var class, 2 K'T'inga classes and a Bird-of-Prey. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and cards.  Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Federation Faction Pack: To Boldly Go...
Description: The Federation Faction Pack: To Boldly Go.. is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Federation faction: a Galaxy class, an Akira class, a Defiant class and a Miranda class. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and cards.  Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.

Name: ASL Comp: Jerusalem – Siege: 1948 and 1967 Action
Description:
This is the Jerusalem: Siege expansion for owners of Genesis 3, Magach 73 and Ivasion: Palestine!. 
Also needed are ASLRB, and Nationalities including British, Germans, Russians - the usual stuff.

This module builds on the Gen/Magach work and includes 6 scenarios, and covers 1948 material from the original Genesis, plus new 1967 actions with an enlarged JERUSALEM Map - in keeping with the MONSTER SERIES, etc. with color rules, and color folio.

Ownership of BOTH Genesis 3 and Magach 73 are a MUST.

-description from the publisher

Name: Wer würfelt Worte?
Description:
Players take turns to roll ten letter-dice. The player who can form a word gets a strike on the notepad. If another player can form a word with more letters, he/she gets that strike, and so on and so forth. The player with the most strikes wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Make Italy!
Description:
"Make Italy" is a wargame for 2-6 players that recreates the campaign for the Unification of Italy at the time of the Expedition of the Thousand (1860).
Players control the six Factions involved in the war, each with their own placement and special traits.
By arranging and moving Agents and Troops on the map, players confront each other diplomatically and militarily, forming Alliances and fighting Battles to take control of the future unitary state.

—description from the publisher
